member.name: T:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1
member.summary: This class represents a simple binary search tree. It's a rooted binary tree, whose internal nodes each store a key and each have two distinguished sub-trees, commonly denoted left and right.

member.name: P:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Count
member.summary: Number of elements of tree.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: This constructor use the given collection for creating a new tree.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: This method adds a new node which contains the given value to the tree.
member.param: The value of the new node.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: This method deletes node which contains the given value from the tree.
member.param: The value of the node which must be deleted.
member.returns: Returns true, if delete operation is successful.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.FindByValue(`0)
member.summary: This method finds the node which contains the given value.
member.param: The value of the sought-for node.
member.returns: Returns the node which contains the given value.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Preorder
member.summary: In this traversal method, the root node is visited first, then left subtree and finally right sub-tree.
member.returns: Returns elements of the tree in the preorder traversal.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Inorder
member.summary: In this traversal method, the left left-subtree is visited first, then root and then the right sub-tree. We should always remember that every node may represent a subtree itself.
member.returns: Returns elements of the tree in the inorder traversal.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Postorder(BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree{`0}.Node)
member.summary: In this traversal method, the root node is visited last, hence the name. First we traverse left subtree, then right subtree and finally root.
member.returns: Returns elements of the tree in the postorder traversal.

member.name: P:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.IsReadOnly
member.summary: This method returns true if the BST is read-only.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Clear
member.summary: This method clears the current tree.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: This method defines does the given element is contains in the tree.
member.param: The value of the sought-for node.
member.returns: Returns true if the tree contains the given element.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.CopyTo(`0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This method copies tree into an array.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: This method returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
member.returns: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.

member.name: T:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node
member.summary: This inner class represents a node of a binary search tree.

member.name: P:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node.Left
member.summary: A left child of a node.

member.name: P:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node.Right
member.summary: A right child of a node.

member.name: P:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node.Parent
member.summary: A parent of the current node.

member.name: P:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node.Value
member.summary: A value which node contains.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: This constructor creates a new node with the given value.

member.name: M:BinarySearchTree.BinarySearchTree`1.Node.ToString
member.summary: This method returns the string presentation of a binary search tree.
member.returns: Returns the string which represents the current binary search tree.
